meanings.definition: Of or relating to asexual reproduction in plants.
meanings.sent1: The apomictic plant can reproduce without needing a mate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the apomictic process in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The apomictic flowers seemed to have a secret way of multiplying on their own.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the apomictic plants were like magic, creating new life without any help.
meanings.sent5: The apomictic nature of the plant made it a fascinating subject for research.

meanings.sent1: The apomictic seeds grew into new plants without any pollen.
meanings.sent2: Farmers were amazed by the apomictic ability of the crop to reproduce on its own.
meanings.sent3: The apomictic process was like a shortcut for the plant to make babies without the usual steps.
meanings.sent4: The field of apomictic seeds was a testament to nature's self-sufficiency.
meanings.sent5: The apomictic trait ensured the plant's survival in harsh conditions.

meanings.definition: A plant that reproduces by apomixis.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was excited to add an apomictic to his collection of unique plants.
meanings.sent2: The apomictic stood out in the garden with its special way of reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The apomictic in the greenhouse seemed to have a mind of its own when it came to making seeds.
meanings.sent4: Among the flowers, the apomictic was a rebel, defying traditional pollination.
meanings.sent5: The apomictic plant was a marvel of nature's ingenuity in propagation.
